RefParameter.Name: Algorithm
RefParameter.Description:
AES Algorithm Mode encryption types list
This parameter can be a value of @ref CRYP_Algorithm_Mode
Possible values are:
CRYP_AES_ECB: Electronic codebook chaining algorithm
CRYP_AES_CBC: Cipher block chaining algorithm
CRYP_AES_CTR: Counter mode chaining algorithm
CRYP_AES_GCM_GMAC: Galois counter mode - Galois message authentication code
CRYP_AES_CCM: Counter with Cipher Mode

RefParameter.Name: DataType
RefParameter.Description:
AES Data Type selection: 32-bit data, 16-bit data, 8-bit data or 1-bit string.
This parameter can be a value of @ref CRYP_Data_Type.
Possible values are:
CRYP_NO_SWAP: 32-bit data type (no swapping)
CRYP_HALFWORD_SWAP: 16-bit data type (half-word swapping)
CRYP_BYTE_SWAP: 8-bit data type (byte swapping)
CRYP_BIT_SWAP: 1-bit data type (bit swapping)

RefParameter.Name: KeySize
RefParameter.Description:
Key size selection: 128 or 256 bit key length.
This parameter can be a value of @ref CRYP_Key_Size.
Possible values are:
CRYP_KEYSIZE_128B: 128-bit long key
CRYP_KEYSIZE_256B: 256-bit long key
if you need to use Shared key between AES and SAES, then you must use the same key size

RefParameter.Name: KeyIVConfigSkip
RefParameter.Description:
CRYP key and IV Configuration Skip Mode:
This parameter can be a value of @ref CRYP_Configuration_Skip.
Possible values are:
CRYP_KEYIVCONFIG_ALWAYS: Peripheral Key and IV configuration to do systematically
CRYP_KEYIVCONFIG_ONCE: Peripheral Key and IV configuration to do only once
CRYP_KEYNOCONFIG: Peripheral Key configuration to not do

RefParameter.Name: KeyMode
RefParameter.Description:
CRYP key Mode:
This parameter can be a value of @ref CRYP_Key_Mode.
Possible values are:
CRYP_KEYMODE_NORMAL: Normal key usage, Key registers are freely useable
CRYP_KEYMODE_WRAPPED: Wrapped key, to encrypt or decrypt AES keys
It is strongly recommended to select the DHUK when KMOD[1:0] is 01, by setting KEYSEL[2:0] to 001 or 100.
CRYP_KEYMODE_SHARED: Shared key
It is strongly recommended to select the DHUK when KMOD[1:0] = 10, by setting KEYSEL[2:0] to 001 or 100.
